Package app

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
app.Controller
public class Controller extends Object
Central part of the program
Version:
2, July 2022

The central part of the program, which facilitates communication between the gui and the model, but the gui cannot change the model /view-model-controller model

Author:
Dominik Baumann, Philipp Grzywaczyk

  • Field Details

    • theBoard

      private LogicBoard theBoard
      The internal representation / model of a Logic Circuit Board.

    • theGUI

      private LogicBoardGUI theGUI
      The view / GUI displaying the model of a Logic Circuit Board.

    • boardSaver

      private BoardSaver boardSaver
      Provides a method for loading a model from a .txt-file.

    • boardLoader

      private BoardLoader boardLoader
      Provides a method for saving the current model as a .txt-file.

    • positionCalculator

      private PositionCalculator positionCalculator
      Allows verification of positions on the visualization of the board and individual tiles / gates.

    • undoableCommands

      private Stack<Command> undoableCommands
      Stores commands that have been executed, such as placing tiles or drawing connections.

      Such commands can be undone (see "Edit"-menu).

      The storage of commands is emptied when

      1. the board is evaluated, and
      2. when a board is successfully loaded from a file.

    • redoableCommands

      private Stack<Command> redoableCommands
      Stores commands that have been undone, such as placing tiles or drawing connections.

      Such commands can be redone again (see "Edit"-menu)

      The storage of commands is emptied when

      1. the board is evaluated, and
      2. when a board is successfully loaded from a file.

    • selectedTileToPlace

      private TileType selectedTileToPlace
      What is the current type of Gate to be added to the model? Equals "null" if no tile is to be placed when clicking on the GUI.

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller()
      The constructor sets up the GUI and model, as well as any other required internals.

  • Method Details

    • handleLeftClick

      public void handleLeftClick(Vector2Int v)
      Having performed a left-click on the GUI will cause the controller to attempt to remove (if the EMPTY Tile was selected in the GUI) or add (otherwise) gates.

      IMPORTANT NOTE:

      The mouse must not be moved (dragged) at all in between clicking and releasing the left mouse button! (otherwise the mouse event is registered as drag, which leads to drawing potential connections)

      Parameters:
      v - The position of the (left) mouse click which has already been translated to coordinates in the grid, i.e. "v" is of the form "v = (row, column)". // TODO row column shenanigans

    • handleRightClick

      public void handleRightClick(Vector2Int v)
      Having performed a right click, the controller attempts to remove a connection between two gates, if the click was close enough to a connection.

      Clicking close to an intersection of connections will remove the one that was placed more recently.

      Parameters:
      v - The position of the (right) mouse click, NOT in grid coordinates.

    • isValidStart

      public boolean isValidStart(Vector2Int v)
      This function checks if a given position on the board is a valid start for a connection, i.e. the input or output of a Gate.

      It first checks for the existence of a Gate, and then has the exact position on the gate verified.

      Parameters:
      v - (World) position on the GUI / model.
      Returns:
      "true" iff position was over an input or the output of a Gate.

    • isValidEnd

      public boolean isValidEnd(Vector2Int v, Vector2Int start)
      This function checks if a given position on the board is a valid end for a connection, i.e. the input or output of a Gate.
      Parameters:
      v - Position under investigation.
      start - Start of the current (potential) connection.
      Returns:
      "true" iff position is over an input or the output of a Gate AND the connection does not form a cycle.

    • saveToFile

      public void saveToFile()
      Save the current board to a file.

    • loadFromFile

      public void loadFromFile()
      Empties the board and tries to load a board model from a .txt-file. If loading fails, restore the board that was present before loading was attempted.

      Successful loading empties the stack of undoable commands.

    • resetBoard

      public void resetBoard()
      Removes all gates (and thus also connections) from the current model. The model notifies the GUI to update afterwards.

    • evaluateCircuits

      public void evaluateCircuits()
      Display the value of the outputs of all gates on the board.

      Green --> output of this gate is true, Red --> output of this gate is false

    • addConnection

      public void addConnection(Vector2Int end, Vector2Int start)
      Connect two gates at the given locations (in world coordinates).

      The GUI does not provide any information on how to connect the gates, i.e. the controller needs to figure out which gate is providing its output and which gate is receiving input (and whether it iss BOTTOM or TOP input).

      Parameters:
      end - one of the gates to connect
      start - one of the gates to connect

    • executeCommand

      private void executeCommand(Command c)
      Executes a given command and places it on the stack if appropriate.
      Parameters:
      c - A command to execute.
      See Also:
      • Command

    • undoCommand

      public void undoCommand()
      Undo the most recent command on the stack (if there is any). And places undone commands on the redo stack, and update the GUI.

    • redoCommand

      public void redoCommand()
      Redo the most recent undone commands on the stack (if there are any). And places redone commands on the undo stack, and update the GUI.

    • resetUndoableCommands

      private void resetUndoableCommands()
      Empty the stack with undoable commands and disable the "Undo" button in the "Edit" menu.

    • resetRedoableCommands

      private void resetRedoableCommands()
      Empty the stack with redoable commands and disable the "Redo" button in the "Edit" menu.

    • numberOfUndoableCommands

      public int numberOfUndoableCommands()
      Returns:
      The count of undoable commands on the corresponding stack of commands.

    • setSelectedTileToPlace

      public void setSelectedTileToPlace(TileType t)
      Set which type of Gate is to be placed on the GUI / in the model when clicking on the GUI.
      Parameters:
      t - Encodes the type of Gate to place.

    • isSelectedTileToPlace

      public boolean isSelectedTileToPlace(TileType t)
      Parameters:
      t - Encodes a type of Gate to compare to the current selection.
      Returns:
      "true" iff the type of Gate to be placed equals the argument.
